settings.title: Return Policy
settings.text: Returns and exchanges are available on any non-sale, non-personalized items within 14 days.

settings.title: Free Shipping Over $75*
settings.text: Spend over $75 in Canada and $100 in USA to get free shipping with your online order

settings.title: 4 Retail Stores
settings.text: Shop in-store in Toronto, Montreal and Vancouver daily.

settings.title: Our Story
settings.richtext:
We design, create and hand stamp meaningful high-quality jewelry. Our collection is curated to house both Suetables-branded original jewelry designs, product collaborations with like-minded creators and soulful brands with whom we share a similar philosophy. Delivering happiness, connection and support for self expression to our community ‘one charm’ at a time. 

From basement hobby business and picking up in Sue’s outdoor “milk box” to four stores and an online website that ships world-wide, Suetables now has built many happy places to shop.  We believe in creating a community filled with story telling, setting intentions and innovation.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path and create and sell personalized products with style and substance. We were the first to hand stamp on jewelry in Canada on the spot. We led the movement of 'demi-fine' jewelry at a reasonable price in Canada.

We are inspired to bring meaning, self discovery, self expression and quality in all that we do. Mark your journey. Tell your story.

settings.title: Shipping Information
settings.home_page_richtext:
We ship out online orders Monday-Friday. Online orders take approximately 2-4 business days to be processed.

LOCAL PICKUP:
You can select Local Pickup at checkout if you wish to pick up your order locally in Toronto, Vancouver or Montreal. Please note that if the items you have in your cart are not stocked at your desired pickup location, you will not be able to select that store.

SHIPPING CARRIERS:
Canadian orders are shipped via Canada Post or UPS and international orders (includes USA) are shipped via UPS or DHL. You will be emailed a tracking number as soon as your package ships.

DUTIES & TAX INFORMATION:
Canadian customers will have retail sales tax added to their order. USA customers can order in Canadian dollars from our site. We will ship anywhere in North America and Europe. Duties are up to the customer to pay upon arrival of package. We do not offer prepaid duties.

settings.title: Our Materials
settings.home_page_richtext:
We are passionate about the metals we use and collections we curate. We also see the importance in consumer-brand transparency. If you have any queries regarding the materials or care of our jewelry you can reach us at info@suetables.com

Sterling Silver

Sterling silver / 925 is a solid metal which is harder than silver and is more suitable for jewelry making. It requires minimal care. However, it may darken over time but can be polished back to new. Check out our jewelry cleaners here https://suetables.com/search?q=cleaner

Solid Gold

Our current lines feature 10k and 14k gold. They are metals that can last a lifetime. It is important to keep in mind that many of our solid gold chains are delicate and are not made for rough wear.

Gold-Filled

Gold-filled is similar to gold plating in that it contains a different base metal. However, for gold filled process the gold is melted onto the base mechanically and requires 5% gold by weight. Thus, the gold coating is much thicker in gold-filled jewelry which improves the quality and longevity. Although gold-filled will maintain its gold appearance for a long time it is important to remember that it can tarnish after time.

Gold Vermeil

Gold Vermeil is a popular type of gold plating with sterling silver as the base metal. Vermeil has a thicker layer of gold than regular gold plating which makes it more hypoallergenic. However it is important to know that with enough wear and tear is possible for the plating to wear. Thus, it is important not to expose gold vermeil to chemicals such as perfume or chlorine.

settings.title: Avoid Water
settings.text: Do not wear jewelry in the water (especially pools/ hot tubs with chemicals).

settings.title: No Perfume
settings.text: Do not spray perfume directly on jewelry.

settings.title: Avoid Sleeping In It
settings.text: It is best to not sleep in your jewelry.

settings.title: Keep It Airtight
settings.text: If possible, keep it in an airtight bag away from sunlight when not in use.

settings.title: Not for Profit & Corporate
settings.home_page_richtext: Suetables also works with companies to create and design one-of-a kind gifts, key chains and jewelry. We are passionate about working with select not-for-profit organizations, like The Special Olympics, Wildlife Now, Royal African Safaris, SickKids Foundation and currently The Maddie Project (North York General Hospital) supporting mental health.

settings.title: We're Here To Help!
settings.home_page_richtext:
The most reliable way to determine your ring size is to visit Suetables or a local jeweller and get measured. You can also bring a ring that fits you or the recipient to get it measured. However, as that is not always possible, here are some tips to help you find your ring size at home!

You will need a plain piece of paper or ribbon, scissors, a ruler and a pen.

STEP 1:
Cut a strip or paper or ribbon (about 1/2” thick and no wider than the band you are planning to purchase) and wrap it around the finger you want to wear the ring on. Using a pen, mark where the two pieces meet. 


STEP 2:
Using a ruler, measure the size of the ribbon or paper in millimeters. Use the guide below to find your size. If you are between sizes, size up. It is important to check the paper is fitting snugly with no folders or bulges, to ensure a correct measurement. If the ring you are wanting to purchase is thicker/wider - such as our 12mm Jack ring - we recommend sizing up.

Size 5: 49.3 mm
Size 6: 51.8 mm
Size 7: 54.4 mm
Size 8: 56.9 mm
Size 9: 59.5 mm
Size 10: 62.1mm

STEP 3:
If you are still unsure of your ring size and have not purchased the ring yet, leave it blank and we can personalize it at a later date. We can not accept returns for rings that are personalized.

settings.title: Size up for thicker bands
settings.text: Putting on a wide band will feel tighter than putting on a skinny band. We recommend you go up a size on our large band rings.

settings.title: Body Temperature
settings.text: Your fingers swell and contract throughout the day. The best time to measure is later in the day (avoid measuring hot or cold hands too).

settings.title: Consider Your Knuckle
settings.text: Make sure your ring will fit over your knuckle and size up if needed.
